translated: Birth Stories
The Twelve-fold Group🔽The Lesser Quail
The Quail’s Riddle
“Those who have never before
in this world made friends for seven steps,
two enemies are born as friends,

original: Paṭisandhāya caranti kissa hetu”.🔽“Yadi me ajja pātarāsakāle,
analyzed: paṭisandhāya caranti kissa hetu  yadi me ajja pāta rāsa kāle
translated: what is the reason for their association?”🔽“If you cannot answer my question
at the time of my breakfast,
I will banish all of you from the country,
for there is no point in having people who are foolish.”
“In the midst of a terrible gathering of many people,
when there is a commotion and a crowd of people,
with minds distracted and many thoughts,
we cannot answer this question.
But each one, with a single-pointed mind,
having gone into seclusion and reflected on the meaning,
having contemplated in solitude, the wise ones,
then, O lord of the people, will answer this question.”
“The flesh of the goat is dear and pleasing
to the sons of Uggapala and the king’s son,

analyzed: na su nakhassa te adenti masa
translated: but they do not give them the flesh of the dog,
so they have friendship with the quail.”
“They cut the skin of the ox,
For the sake of the pleasure of scratching the back of the donkey;
But the dog does not scratch the donkey’s itch,
But the donkey has friendship with the ass.”
“The donkey has a twisted horn,
But the dog has no tusks;
He eats grass and eats meat,
But the donkey has friendship with the ass.”
“The donkey eats grass and leaves,

original: Na ca sunakho tiṇamāsi no palāsaṁ;
analyzed: na ca su nakhaḥ tiṇamāsi na u palāsa
translated: But the dog does not eat grass or leaves;
He would catch a hare or a deer,
But the donkey has friendship with the ass.”
“The donkey has eight legs and four feet,
The donkey has eight hooves and is invisible;
He takes away this one’s food,

analyzed: masam āharatī ayam amussa  pāsāda vara gataḥ videha seṭṭhaḥ
translated: He brings meat for that one.🔽The best of Videha, in his excellent palace,
The going out and the mutual feeding of the two;
The lord of men saw the witness, it seems,
Of the one who is full of hunger and mouth full.”
“Indeed, I have gained great profit,
That in my family there are these wise ones;
The profound and subtle meaning of the question,

analyzed: paṭivijjhanti su bhāsitena dhīrā  assatari rathañca ekam eka
translated: The wise penetrate with a well-spoken word.🔽Each a chariot with a donkey yoked,

analyzed: phītam gām avaram ca ekam eka
translated: And each a fine village,
I give to all of you wise men,
With my mind supremely pleased with the well-spoken word.”
The Meṇḍaka Questions, the eighth.
